When using filters on backlog, I can see if/how many subtasks inside task were actually hidden by applying this filter.

Using backlog split since Jira 8.0, I don't know if issue has subtasks I don't see (because of they are hidden by the split) or not.

fields.description:
Hello,



We are having trouble after tempo update.

1. Jira > Add-ons > Tempo > Scheduler > Operations > Edit following the steps

Type = Weekly 
Repeat on (Weekly) = Monday
Make Scheduler Close = Marked
Close = 0 working days after end date
Activate This Scheduler = Marked

After making the above settings, users in the system cannot log work on Tuesday.

2. Jira > Tempo > Teams > Contains Text (We write the name of the team that we have created before.) > Add Jira Group > Select JIRA user groups (We write the name of the group that we have created before.)> Next > group_all ( 389 Users ) (Warning: Adding more than 25 users to a team can negatively affect performance. ) following the steps

After the transaction is completed, the contacts of the added group in the same page come as 0 (empty).

3. The person is having a validation problem after the weekly period is sent for approval. The approving person cannot see the confirmation button.

4. The tempo entries of passive jira users do not appear.

can you help with the issue.
fields.summary: We are having trouble after tempo update.

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

In the documentation, [Advanced searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-939938733.html], it doesn't elaborate in detail regarding the field 'statusCategory'. The field 'statusCategory' has 3 values which is 'Open', 'In Progress' and 'Done'. However, there is another value which is 'indeterminate' which returns same results as 'In Progress'. This value is not shown on auto-complete. Please add additional details regarding this.

Indeterminate value is mentioned in developer's documentation : [https://docs.atlassian.com/DAC/javadoc/jira/reference/com/atlassian/jira/issue/status/category/StatusCategory.html]
fields.summary: Include statusCategory field in Jira Advanced Searching documentation

fields.description:
h1.Problem
It is very time consuming to hand-craft access to Jira REST API.

The provided API description is UI: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest

h1.Suggested Solution:
I want to generate a client automatically against a Swagger document.

For example I could use AutoRest to generate a client in C#, NodeJS, Python, Java, Ruby or Go: https://github.com/Azure/autorest.

Please could you publish Swagger document in JSON or YAML that describes Jira REST API?
{quote}
fields.summary: Swagger (Open API) JSON or YAML for Jira REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing a filter, then, adding a 'User' editor, the username will not appear in the Editors column, instead it will be appearing as '*Пользователь*: «*»**'* or translated as 'User: «*»'* .
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Set the default language and profile language to Russian.
 # Head to *Issues > Manage filters*.
 # Head to a specified filter, click on *Edit*.
 # Under *Редакторы* (Editors), click on 'Пользователь' (User) and choose a user. Click on *Add*.

h3. Expected Results

Editors column will show "Пользователь: user1'.
h3. Actual Results

Editors column will show 'Пользователь: «»' instead.
fields.summary: When editing filters and adding a 'User' editor, the username does not appear in the 'Editor' column when using Russian as default language
Updating issue type via Rest API ignores differences in issue type workflows leading to inconsistent state.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Look and Feel menu does not allow users to change the colors used in reports and gadgets. When options in Look and Feel are modified it has no impact on the colors used inside of the reports or gadgets. Users would like to customize their colors.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide options via Look and Feel menu for users to change the colors used inside reports and gadgets.
h3. Why this is important

Customizing colors is important because it allows for admins to use colors best suited for their users. For example, certain reports such as Created versus Resolved are hard to see for colorblind users. Be able to customize colors would allow for the affected user to fully enjoy Jira reporting.
fields.summary: Allow customized colors to be set for Reporting and Gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Switching between advanced/basic mode with a complex query causes custom fields to disappear from the query.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JQL query that includes a custom field in Advanced View
 # Switch to Basic View and modify the search, for example, set Assignee to Current User
 # Go back to Advanced View and observe that the custom field is removed
 *Note* that now the "basic" link is greyed out and unclickable. If you mouse over that section you get a popup that says "This query is too complex to display in Simple mode."

h3. Expected Results

The JQL remains the same.
h3. Actual Results

The custom field gets removed.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Switching between advanced/basic mode with a complex query causes custom fields to disappear from query

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In April 2018, Fogbugz started storing new attachments into Amazon S3 and migrated existing ones into S3 as well:
https://support.fogbugz.com/hc/en-us/articles/360011263014-New-Features-2018-04-23. Jira fails to import migrated attachments (older than April 2018) but can import newer attachments, added after April 2018.

It is possible to download the Fogbugz attachment using Fogbugz API.

h3. Environment
Replication requires Fogbugz instance with cases having attachments older than April 2018

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Try to import issues into JIRA using the FogBugz importer provided under JIRA's external system import.

h3. Expected Results
Issues import successfully with their attachments

h3. Actual Results
The import throws errors about certain attachments illustrated below
{noformat}
2018-10-25 15:22:11,245 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 ERROR username 
855x653x1 1qt0j4i 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/ImporterLogsPage%21import.jspa 
[c.a.j.p.i.i.importer.impl.AbstractDataImporter$1Thread[http-nio-8080-exec-7,5,main]] 
Error retrieving attachment
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.fogbugz.hosted.FogBugzRemoteException: 
HTTP Error code HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden [Content-Type: application/xml, 
Transfer-Encoding: chunked, Connection: keep-alive, Date: Thu, 25 Oct 2018 
20:22:10 GMT, Server: AmazonS3, X-Cache: Error from cloudfront, Via: 1.1 
c3fb36940fb36cf227975bfb7c09ea6d.cloudfront.net (CloudFront), X-Amz-Cf-Id: 
mKG_ETdkY4iIZIwLWYtrED5ah9rV6VCe--1KGDWYhrz_FBw2KHw==] 
org.apache.http.conn.BasicManagedEntity@26af7748 returned by the server
at 
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.fogbugz.hosted.FogBugzAPIClient.getWithToken0(FogBugzAPIClient.java:167)
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround
Download attachments separately using FogBugz APIs and then import respective JIRA issues using the CSV importer or using JIRA's REST API.
*Relevant KBs*
[Bulk import attachments to JIRA using REST API|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/bulk-import-attachments-to-jira-issues-via-rest-api-729750741.html]
[Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html#ImportingdatafromCSV-howRunningtheCSVfileimportwizard]
[Export FogBugz cases to CSV|https://support.fogbugz.com/hc/en-us/articles/360011243974-Export-to-CSV]
[FogBugz Knowledgebase|https://help.manuscript.com/fogbugz]
fields.summary: FogBugz import not working with attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When embedding JIRA issue collector code into an html or Javascript the issue collector *Provide Feedback* button is not displayed. 
The form can't be loaded.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.12.3 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.12.3
# Create a poject
# From the project setting configure an issue collector, copy the code to embed the issue collector form into a test html.
# Follow the JIRA html example and embed the code
# Load the html page

h3. Expected Results
Issue collector *Provide Feedback* button appears and when clicked the form is loaded and we can submit an issue.

h3. Actual Results
The page is broken and both Firefox and Chrome will block the page loading from completion with a console error similar to below:
{code}
Refused to execute script from 'http://localhost:17123/jira7123/rest/collectors/1.0/configuration/trigger/5a369a02?os_authType=none&callback=trigger_5a369a02' because its MIME type ('text/html') is not executable, and strict MIME type checking is enabled.
{code}
 !Screenshot_20181203_144234.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* Most modern browsers will do strict checks on Mime Types and there is no way to stop them from doing that due to security reasons. 
* in JIRA 7.12.3, The call to the REST Endpoint */rest/collectors/1.0/configuration/trigger/d60737ee* uses the wrong *Content-Type* header, the expected type is:
{code}
Content-Type: application/x-javascript;charset=UTF-8
{code}
While the code sends a wrong content type:
{code}
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
{code} 
Which causes the browser Mime type check to fail.
* Both JIRA 7.6.10 and 7.13.0 doesn't show this problem.
 !Screenshot_20181203_143202.png|thumbnail!  !Screenshot_20181203_151551.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Upgrade to JIRA 7.13.0, the issue is not observed there.
fields.summary: Issue collector form is broken

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

The community link in the *Troubleshooting and support tools* at *Administration > System > Troubleshooting and support tools (under System Support)*. 

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to *Administration > System > Troubleshooting and support tools (under System Support) > Get help*. 
# Or access through the *Report a problem* then *Get help*. 
# Click on *Community help*. 

h3. *Expected Results*

Jira will bring you to the Atlassian Community via the link [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/topics/753669/jira]. 

h3. *Actual Results*

The link is instead routed to an error page: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/errors/error404page]. 

h3. *Workaround*

Manually search up in your browser for Atlassian Community or click on this link [https://community.atlassian.com/].
fields.summary: The Community Link in Troubleshooting and support tools is not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, a ticket can only have the project components values in the Component/s system field. 
In some scenarios, users need to use component data more than once in a ticket. For example: the component where a bug is visible and the component that triggered the bug. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admins to create custom field with *Component Picker* type so they can use the project component data outside the Component/s system field. 
h3. Workaround
If on *Jira Server*, the [Component Picker add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217020/component-picker?hosting=server&tab=overview] can be used.
fields.summary: Create a field type Component Picker for custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if JIRA is configured with AD which has the password policy where users password are expired after a certain time and the user selected "Remember my Login" option in login screen; and the password expires, the user will not be able to login till they clear the browser cache.

This is mainly because the browser needs the existing cookies to be cleared and cookie with an updated credential is created in order for the user to login.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow JIRA to invalidate the cookie for JIRA if it detects that the authentication failure. This way, the user will be able to relogin to JIRA by inserting their latest password.


h3. Workaround 

# JIRA Administrator can clear the token for all the users monthly from "<JIRA's URL>/secure/admin/user/AllUsersRememberMeCookies!default.jspa". This will require the users to update their credential at least once per month.
# Rather than using the "Remember my login" option, users can use browse's password manager.
fields.summary: AD password expiration and Remember my login

fields.description: If the dates were alwasy in iso format (yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss) they'd be easy to sort, but the additin of numbered comments would help too. so instead of 'fred added a comment 6 months ago' if you said 'fred added comment 17 about 6 months ago on 2018/06/21 13:42:14' you would know that it was in responce to a prior comment that was also 6 months ago; which are currently indistiguishable.
fields.summary: Item comments are difficult to order

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a workaround for JRASERVER-64922, a new mechanism has been added to Jira, that retries the failed index operation events.

The current solution works in-memory (is not persistent), not attempting the retries if the node is restarted. 

h3. Suggested Solution
A potential improvement would be to store data about the operations to retry in the database.

This would not only allow for a more resilient solution but also to potentially browse the historical data about the failed index replication requests across the DC cluster.
fields.summary: Make Jira DC replication event retry mechanism more resilient

fields.description: The VerifyPopServerConnection resource in Atlassian Jira before version 7.6.10, from version 7.7.0 before version 7.7.5, from version 7.8.0 before version 7.8.5, from version 7.9.0 before version 7.9.3, from version 7.10.0 before version 7.10.3, from version 7.11.0 before version 7.11.3, from version 7.12.0 before version 7.12.3, and from version 7.13.0 before version 7.13.1 allows remote attackers who have administrator rights to determine the existence of internal hosts & open ports and in some cases obtain service information from internal network resources via a Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability.
fields.summary: The VerifyPopServerConnection resource was vulnerable to SSRF - CVE-2018-13404

fields.description:
A common problem is have is overwriting each others issues.  2 of us are creating stories and we don't know when the other is currently the story.  My partner will be in the story, I come in and make a change, then she saves her changes and wipes mine out. (We work in a Kanban setting).

Jira would be greatly improved if it had a marker to tell users when another user had the story open in edit mode.  Here are my suggestions.  

If an issue is open in edit mode
 # in the issue listing page (Kanban board), add "In use" in red text in the lower right corner above the issue number.
 # in the actual issue page, display in red text on the top of the page "[user name] is currently editing this story.  You risk overwriting your associate's changes, or your associate may overwrite your changes.
fields.summary: Make editing issues better by minimizing overwrites

fields.description:
I'm seeing several issues when editing links in the Visual editor.

On a Mac using Safari 12.0.1 or Chrome 70.0.3538.110, running Mac OS 10.14.1., accessing Jira Server 7.12.3.
 # Copy a URL like [https://www.google.com|https://www.google.com/] to the clipboard from any text editor.
 # Go to a Jira issue and add a comment, using the Visual editor.
 # Type some text, select it, and type command-K. *Nothing happens.*
 # Instead, select External Link from the Link menu in the toolbar. The selected text becomes a wiki-style link like {{[test|http://example.com]}}, *which seems wrong since we're in a visual editor*.
 # Select the text after the | character, "{{http://example.com}}", and type command-V to paste; this should replace the example URL with the one we copied.
 # Instead of changing the text after the | character to the pasted text, it changes {{http://example.com}} to a blue underlined link to [https://www.google.com,|https://www.google.com%2C/]. So the resulting text looks like {{[test|[http://example.com|http://example.com/]]}}. *You get a visual-style link within a wiki-style link.*

Or there's this:
 # Go to a Jira issue and add a comment, using the Visual editor.
 # Type a URL followed by a space. It becomes a blue underlined link.
 # Backspace over the end of the URL and type some text to change it. For example, change [https://www.google.com|https://www.google.com/] to [https://www.google.biz.|https://www.google.biz./]
 # Type a space and continue typing. *Everything you type becomes part of the URL*, even after the space. So it ends up looking like: [https://www.google.biz etc etc|https://www.google.com/]
 # In addition, *the actual destination of the link is unchanged*; it still goes to [https://www.google.com.|https://www.google.com./]
 # And *you can't edit the destination* either. Selecting External Link from the toolbar just wraps another wiki-style link around the original one.
fields.summary: Various issues editing links in visual editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you remove a user from a group added to the dashboard Editors, that user will not be able to edit their own dashboard directly from the Dashboard. 

On Jira 8.5.0-8.5.4, this problem is also experienced if shared to "Anyone on the web", but _Jira Admin -> System -> General Configuration -> Sharing with anyone on the web_ is turned off. This makes it harder for users to remove this permission from their own dashboards. 

h3. Environment
 * Jira Software 7.12 introduced the ability to share edit rights for filters and dashboards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and Save a Dashboard
 # Add a Crowd Group that you are a member of as a Editor of the Dashboard
 # Verify you can edit the Dashboard
 # Remove your account from the Crowd Group
 # You can no longer share or edit the Dashboard directly from the Dashboard despite being the owner.

h3. Expected Results
 * Users should always be able to edit a dashboard they own.

h3. Actual Results
 * The user can no longer share or edit the Dashboard directly from the Dashboard despite being the owner.

h3. Workaround
 # Navigate to Dashboards > Manage Dashboards > My
 # Click the gear icon next to your Dashboard
 # Add your account as an Editor

 * Alternatively, you can add yourself back to the group you were removed from. Users may move between roles in a company but still need to edit the Dashboards they own.
fields.summary: When you remove a user from a group added to the Dashboard Editors, that user will not be able to edit their own Dashboard

fields.description:
We should look at adding timezone support to dates. This would allow the users to create dates that were consistent no matter where they are run. The main change will be to JQLDateSupport.ACCEPTED_FORMATS and the tests.

For example: 2008/09/12 GMT.Add time

Here is my scenario. We have Shift 1 in India and Shift 2 in USA. I write a query to find all tickets that are still open to let Shift 2 take over. When a Shift 1 person gives that query to a Shift 2 person it is 12.5 hours into the past, and is useless.

But if I could include a timezone, or at least specify to use server time zone that would fix it.

Copy of JRASERVER-59615

Here is my example query:

project = "Security Incidents" AND status was in ("Create", Detect, "In Progress",Analysis) during ("2018/11/27 18:30", "2018/11/28 02:30") AND "Assignment Group" in (Tier-1, Tier-2) AND status was not in (Closed,Validated) DURING ("2018/11/27 18:30", "2018/11/28 02:30")
fields.summary: Add timezone support to JQL dates.

fields.description:
Jira supports -dashes around text- for overstriking in rich text fields and comments. Finnish text tends to trigger this interpretation unintentionally, because the orthography occasionally requires a dash at the start or end of a word. The overstriking can be removed by adding a backslash in front of each dash, or by replacing each dash with &#45;. However, we don't really use overstriking by purpose, so it would be easier for users if we could disable overstriking altogether in the Jira Server instance, or have the rich text editor add those backslashes itself.

*Example:* Jira Server -koulutus on tiistaina. JavaScript- ja TypeScript-kurssit pidetään seuraavalla viikolla.

*Renders as:* Jira Server -koulutus on tiistaina. JavaScript- ja TypeScript-kurssit pidetään seuraavalla viikolla.

*Translation:* The Jira Server training will be on Tuesday. The JavaScript and TypeScript courses will be held next week.
fields.summary: Disable -overstrike markup-

fields.description:
Users would like for Jira to export columns from search based on columns seen on the screen
 # open a saved search with multiple custom fields (columns)
 # edit the query
 # go to Export > Excel (Current Fields)

Expected result: Export contains the same columns as is seen on the screen

Actual result: Export contains only the fields in personal column order (if you have set this) or the system default

Business case: User would like for Jira to inspect the columns on screen to include in the export so that it is no longer necessary to save the edited filter to a new name. This causes the users to 1) have the extra step of naming and saving the filter, and 2) removing the temporary filter in order to clean-up saved searches
fields.summary: Users would like for Jira to export columns in search based on what is last on screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to check the JIRA status using the URL http(s)://<JIRA_BASE_URL>/status
JIRA presents a login page, and no status is reported.

h3. Environment
*  JIRA 7.12.3
* 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.12.3
# from the command line, execute the command:
{code}
curl http://localhost:8080/status
{code}

h3. Expected Results
You should get a JSON object similar to below:
{code}
{"state":"MAINTENANCE"}
{code}
Or
{code}
{"state":"RUNNING"}
{code}

h3. Actual Results
JIRA offers a long page, no JSON is received:
{code}
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>

<meta charset="utf-8">
<meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=Edge"/>
<title>Log in - Jira7123</title>
<meta name="application-name" content="JIRA" data-name="jira" data-version="7.12.3"><meta name="ajs-server-scheme" content="http">
{code}
 
h3. Notes
Issue is not happening on JIRA 7.12.1 or on JIRA 7.13.0

h3. Workaround
Avoid looking for the JSON status object data while using the status URL for load balancing or monitoring health checks.
fields.summary: JIRA http(s)://<JIRA_BASE_URL>/status URL is invoking JIRA login page, not reporting status.

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Edit Issue in Microsoft Edge with the Assignee field hidden from Screen will clear the Assignee if it is the current user.
h3. *Environment*
 * Microsoft Edge

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Use Microsoft Edge to access JIRA.
 # Open a new project and create a new issue.
 # Assign the ticket to yourself which is also the current user.
 # Edit the ticket and hide the Assignee field (which is current set to the logged in user) simply by untick it from the *_Configure Field > Custom_*.
 # Save it and you will notice that the Assignee is clear.

h3. *Expected Results*

Just update the ticket values from the Edit Screen and nothing else.
h3. *Actual Results*

The assignee of the ticket is clear. 
  
h3. *Notes*

This is critical as in this customer case, the ticket involved payment to other parties. Un-assigning the ticket will cause it to go back to their queue of payment processing.
h3. *Workaround*

No workaround other than using a different browser is known at the moment.
fields.summary: Edit Issue in Microsoft Edge with the Assignee field hidden from Edit Screen will clear the Assignee if it is the current user

fields.description:
h3. Problem

During disaster recovery, the pattern used for identifying index snapshot files matches only *.zip files. This pattern should include .tar and .tar.sz. Snappy and tarball archive was introduced in Jira 7.12 and users can choose the type of archiving used for creating snapshots. Currently, Snappy is the default option. This will produce snapshots that cannot be used by the disaster recovery mechanism. Since disaster recovery is a feature of Jira DC, this is a regression.
h3. Expected behaviour

Disaster recovery mechanism should be able to use any index snapshot created by Jira itself.
h3. Workaround

In a case where the only available snapshot is a tarball or Snappy archive, unarchiving and compressing it to a zip archive will work. However, if the snapshot size is large, which is expected in Jira DC, this method most likely wouldn't be able to satisfy the high availability requirements.
h3. Notes

See  {{com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DisasterRecoveryLauncher#restoreIndex}} and {{com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.IndexUtils#INDEX_SNAPSHOT_PATTERN}}
fields.summary: DC Disaster recovery ignores index snapshots when Snappy or tarball archive is used

fields.description:
h3. Problem 
{{DefaultIndexCopyService}} doesn't clean old index snapshots in {{caches/}} under Jira shared home director when Snappy archiver is used. It only works with zip snapshots.
Snappy archiver is used by default for Jira 7.12.0 and newer.

h3. Expected behaviour
{{DefaultIndexCopyService}} should keep at most 3 index snapshots in {{caches/}} under Jira shared home directory. 

h3. Workaround 1
Disable snappy archiver by setting
{noformat}index.use.snappy = false{noformat}

h3. Workaround 2
Manually inspect and remove old {{IndexSnapshot_*}} files from {{caches/}} directory from time to time. 

h3. Note
See {{IndexUtils#INDEX_SNAPSHOT_EXT}}.
fields.summary: DC index copy does not clean up old files when Snappy archiver is used

*[Jira Software 7.12.x upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-12-x-upgrade-notes-955173978.html]* mentioned:
{quote}
h2. Upgrading from earlier versions?

...
 * *Earlier than 7.0* 
 Consult the [Migration hub|https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7]. The Jira 7.0 release introduced significant changes. You must first upgrade to Jira 7.0 before upgrading to later versions.{quote}
*[Skipping major versions when upgrading Jira applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/skipping-major-versions-when-upgrading-jira-applications-802592265.html]* mentioned:
{quote}Jira Software specific notes
 If you plan to upgrade from Jira and Jira Agile less than 6.4.x and 6.3.5 respectively, you must upgrade to Jira Software 7.0 before upgrading to Jira Software 7.1.
{quote}
However, it would be great to *instruct users to specifically upgrade to Jira 7.0.11* (the last release of 7.0) to avoid users running into [known issues within the release versions of 7.0.x.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-0-x-release-notes-776997721.html]

Other alternative would be to include *small note about the known issues* so users would just skip the affected version releases.

For example, a user in [GHS-135977|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-135977], was in the process of upgrading to Jira 7.0.0 (as the intermediate version), and he ran into the bug JRASERVER-47267 which affected Oracle users and users coming from Jira 6.4.8 or later.
fields.summary: Update Jira upgrade notes

fields.description:
Currently Jira requires that a user have project administration permissions in order to create and manage versions and releases.

This is not particularly practical for software dev shops that have release managers. We certainly don't want to have to allow our release manager access to all of the administrative functionality that project administration access allows, but there's currently no way to allow someone in that role to manage versions and releases without providing that access.
fields.summary: Provide granular permissions for managing releases and versions

fields.description:
When a customer writes a long comment I will copy that text into a new comment and then surround my comment in brackets to denote my response.

For example: ***

{ !https://jira.cargill.com/images/icons/emoticons/check.png|width=16,height=16!  done}

*

When I am writing the comment the (/) icon appears correctly, but when I save the comment it shows:

{{* {(/) done}* }}

where the checkmark icon does not render as an icon image and stays as text.

When I edit the comment and a space before the text that should render as an icon and then save the comment again then the text renders as the appropriate icon.

 

I expected to not need to separate the text that should render as an icon by spaces.

 

_I tried to add as a bug, but it gave me an error that said that I do not have assign privileges._
fields.summary: BUG: Icon (emoji) does not show when preceded by { character

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When logging is enabled at a high level, for example, all com.atlassian packages.

Log4j cannot handle log rotation and the atlassian-jira.log grows extremely quickly.

h3. Suggested Solution
- Add a warning or prevent users from adding logging at this level. 
- Use a different approach for logging.

h3. Workaround 
- Add more resources to support the rotation 
- Change the log4j settings to rotate at a larger amount of data (larger than 20MB) or 
- Change the debug logging level for the package
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like Jira to handle large log rotation more gracefully

fields.description:
Java 9 added a common logging system for JVM components. Unified JVM logging system has one drawback which I found during Java 11 migration. We cannot define an absolute path in Windows e.g.
{code:java}
C:\logs\abc.log{code}
because
{code:java}
:{code}
is not compatible with logging system syntax.

More information about syntax:
 * [https://dzone.com/articles/disruptive-changes-to-gc-logging-in-java-9]
 * [https://grokonez.com/java/java-9/java-9-unified-jvm-logging]
 * [https://blog.gceasy.io/2017/10/17/43-gc-logging-flags-removed-in-java-9/]

 *Workaround*: Customers can use relative paths.

I am glad I could help.

Best regards,

[~mmasiorski@atlassian.com]

 

CC: [~lwlodarczyk]
fields.summary: GC params limitation on Windows

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When deleting a version, Jira checks if the version is used in custom fields.
This is done in methods _versionService.getCustomFieldIssuesCount_ and _versionService.getCustomFieldsUsing_.

The check is very slow on big instances, even if the instance contains no custom fields that are version pickers.
h4. Expected results

If instance contains no custom version pickers, the queries should execute almost immediately.
h4. Notes

For a bigger context, see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67198
fields.summary: SQL for checking usages of version in custom fields is slow even if no version picker custom fields exist

fields.description:
There are two temporary directories that Jira uses;
 * <JIRA_HOME_DIR>/tmp
 * <JIRA_INSTALL_DIR>/temp

Documentation, [Important directories and files|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/important-directories-and-files-861253886.html], states for <JIRA_HOME_DIR>/tmp that
{quote}*tmp*

Any temporary content created for various runtime functions such as exporting, importing, file upload and indexing is stored under this directory.

You can remove files from this directory while JIRA is running, but we recommend that you shut down JIRA first before altering the contents of this directory.
{quote}
However, this definition seems to belong to <JIRA_INSTALL_DIR>/temp instead of <JIRA_HOME_DIR>/tmp, as java.io.tempdir environment variable is set to <JIRA_INSTALL_DIR>/temp on a default installation.
h3. Current outcome

As described above
h3. Expected outcome

<JIRA_INSTALL_DIR>/temp is added to the documentation with the correct definition
fields.summary: Jira - Clarify documentation on temporary directories <JIRA_HOME_DIR>/tmp and <JIRA_INSTALL_DIR>/temp

jira-software-language-pack-ko_KR-7.12.1.v20180831091209.jar
jira-software-language-pack-nl_NL-7.12.1.v20180831091209.jar
jira-software-language-pack-no_NO-7.12.1.v20180831091209.jar
jira-software-language-pack-pl_PL-7.12.1.v20180831091209.jar
jira-software-language-pack-pt_BR-7.12.1.v20180831091209.jar
jira-software-language-pack-ro_RO-7.12.1.v20180831091209.jar
jira-software-language-pack-ru_RU-7.12.1.v20180831091209.jar
jira-software-language-pack-sk_SK-7.12.1.v20180831091209.jar
jira-software-language-pack-sv_SE-7.12.1.v20180831091209.jar
jira-software-language-pack-zh_CN-7.12.1.v20180831091209.jar
{quote}

Some JIRA Administrators prefers to remove some of the language packs since it's not used by their users. However, during JIRA upgrade, all the bundled language packs will be restored automatically and the JIRA Administrator will have to remove the unused language package manually again.

Some JIRA Administrators would like feature with the upgrade where JIRA will only install language pack currently available in <installed-plugins>.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add a feature in JIRA where JIRA will be checking the bundled language pack available in <installed-plugins> folder and only install the language stored in the <installed-plugins> during each upgrade.


h3. Workaround 

Manually remove the unused bundled language packs from <installed-plugins> folder

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JQL query doesn't return matching issues if fixVersion field is a numeric string (123) instead of traditional version float/double value (1.2.3). Only queries with exact matching {{fixVersion = 123}} returns expected result(s)

In the background:
 * If a float/double value is searched for - looks like Lucene takes it as the *field value* (vname column)
 * If an integer/string is searched for - it seems Lucene considers it the *field string* (id column)

h3. Environment
 * Tested on 7.6.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a version which is an numeric string like viz., '100' and *not* 1.0.0
 # Assign the version as the fixVersion on an issue
 # JQL search with {{project = XYZ and fixVersion was 100}}

 _the above would *not* show any result_

 # JQL search with {{project = XYZ and fixVersion = 100}}

 _the above will show result_

h3. Expected Results

Since it's valid to enter any varchar value in Version ("vname" column), the expected behaviour would be to get results against {{project = XYZ and fixVersion was 100}} 

{code:sql}
jira769=> \d+ projectversion
                               Table "public.projectversion"
   Column    |           Type           | Modifiers | Storage  | Stats target | Description
-------------+--------------------------+-----------+----------+--------------+-------------
 id          | numeric(18,0)            | not null  | main     |              |
 ...
 vname       | character varying(255)   |           | extended |              |
 ...
{code}
h3. Actual Results

Here's my projectversion table:
{code:sql}
jira769=> select * from projectversion ;
  id   | project | vname | description | sequence | released | archived | url | startdate | releasedate
-------+---------+-------+-------------+----------+----------+----------+-----+-----------+-------------
 10000 |   10100 | 10    | 1000        |        1 |          |          |     |           |
 10001 |   10100 | 20    | 2000        |        2 |          |          |     |           |
(2 rows)
{code}

 * JQL {{project = uyfkhgf AND fixVersion was 10}} doesn't return matching issue(s)

 * JQL {{project = uyfkhgf AND fixVersion was 10000}} shows matching issue(s)

 * JQL {{project = uyfkhgf AND fixVersion = 10}} shows matching issue(s)

h3. Workaround
 * Use the field string (id) value in your JQL query
 * For older Jira version (6.4.13) where we could enter double-quotes (fixVersion was "10") in the JQL query) it would work
fields.summary: JQL query doesn't return matching issues if fixVersion field is a numeric string (123) instead of traditional version float/double value (1.2.3)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/jira document (referred to in our official docs e.g. https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/getting-started-with-jira-data-center-on-aws-938846966.html) points to a template maintained in https://github.com/aws-quickstart/quickstart-atlassian-jira which hasn't been updated in a while. This repo points users to raise feedback in a different repo on Bitbucket https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment which appears to be more up to date.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update our official JIRA Data Center getting started documentation to point to newer templates in the Bitbucket Repo instead.

h3. Why this is important
* The AWS template in the Bitbucket repo template is actually more up to date with more customization options and features than the old template e.g it provides more choices of EC2 instance types. It is also more consistent with the quickstart deployment for other Atlassian products
* The old repo is no longer being maintained so pointing to it in our documentation does create some confusion to users.
fields.summary: Update JIRA AWS quick start quide to point to Bitbucket repo

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The browse attachment icon is missing in the Create Issue screen. This only occurs when Jira's default language is not English.

h3. Environment
Jira configured to use any other language but English, as default language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Jira Administration > System > General Configuration
# Edit the 'Default language' from English to some other language on the list
# Trigger the Create Issue screen and observe the Description field

h3. Expected Results
The 'browse attachment' icon appears next to the 'link' icon in the Description field
!browse-attachment-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The 'browse attachment' icon is missing in the Description field
 !browse-attachment-0.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Use the 'browse' feature in the Attachment field
fields.summary: Missing 'browse attachment' icon in Create Issue screen when default language is not English

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Jira has full reindex process. If any error happends during this time, error is accumulated and showed at the end, eg:
{noformat}
2018-11-13 10:01:07,436 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 ERROR admin 1139x124894x1 1s 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All FAILED. Indexer: DefaultIndexManager: paths: [/jira/caches/indexes/comments, /jira/caches/indexes/issues, /jira/caches/indexes/changes, /jira/caches/indexes/worklogs, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-files, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-pullrequestinfos, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-revisions]
com.atlassian.jira.index.IndexingFailureException: Indexing completed with 2 errors
at com.atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(AccumulatingResultBuilder.java:150)
...
{noformat}

In some cases, reindexing process for 3m+ issues might take 20+h and at the same time, number of errors could be quite small (~10) so it's preferable to have non-consistent index then to loose all that accumulated work. 
It could also mitigate problems like JRASERVER-69826 

h4. Suggestion
* Allow Jira Admin to decide tolerated level of error during reindexing

Extra
* Create a tool which will allow to identify missing issues and fix the discrepancy.
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin I want to configure a tolerate threshold for amount of errors during Jira reindexing

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Jira has full reindex process. If any error happends during this time, error is accumulated and showed at the end, eg:
{noformat}
2018-11-13 10:00:27,704 IssueIndexer:thread-31 INFO admin 1139x124894x1 1s 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.w.a.admin.index.IndexAdminImpl] Re-indexing is 98% complete. Current index: Issue

Indexer: DefaultIndexManager: paths: [/jira/caches/indexes/comments, /jira/caches/indexes/issues, /jira/caches/indexes/changes, /jira/caches/indexes/worklogs, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-files, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-pullrequestinfos, /jira/caches/indexes/plugins/jira-git-revisions]
com.atlassian.jira.index.IndexingFailureException: Indexing completed with 2 errors
at com.atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(AccumulatingResultBuilder.java:150)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.doIndexIssuesInBatchMode(DefaultIndexManager.java:1016)

at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.withReindexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:377)

{noformat}

The problem is that the error just says: _Indexing completed with 2 errors_ without providing more details, so it doesn't help with troubleshooting and it's quite hard to find the cause. 

Actual problem could be many hours (logs files) before, eg:
{noformat}
2018-11-12 23:21:25,468 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN admin 1139x124894x1 1s 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] Indexing failed for Issue - '1847432'
2018-11-12 23:21:25,469 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN admin 1139x124894x1 1s 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, rolelevel, actionbody, CREATED, UPDATEAUTHOR, UPDATED, actionnum FROM jiraaction WHERE issueid=? AND actiontype=? (No more data to read from socket)
java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, rolelevel, actionbody, CREATED, UPDATEAUTHOR, UPDATED, actionnum FROM jiraaction WHERE issueid=? AND actiontype=? (No more data to read from socket)
{noformat}


h4. Suggestion
Improve logging and accumulate actual error.
fields.summary: Improve logging for Jira Lucene reindexing
Information about on which node the Background Reindexing is triggered.

Currently it is not possible to append the transition name into the wehbook URL. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add transition name as a valid variable substitution in the webhook URL
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like the Web Hook URL to also append variable for Transition Name

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the default Component field allows users to insert multiple values. However, some administrators would like to allow users to only insert a single value at a time.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow JIRA Administrator to set the Component field as either single selection field or multi selection field.


h3. Workaround 

Users can install the JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions and add an additional validator "Field Has Single Value" in the transition to check only a single selection is made for the component.

(i) This will require installing a third party add-on.
fields.summary: Allow Administrator to limit Component field for single selection instead of multiple selection

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If we have an user in both the internal and LDAP directory and remove him from the LDAP synchronization, Jira deletes the LDAP row from the cwd_user table.
If we have an user only in the LDAP directory and remove him from the LDAP synchronization, Jira will only disable the user instead of deleting from cwd_user.

h3. How to reproduce
Let's say we used to have only an Internal Directory, and decided to migrate them to an LDAP directory (AD). After the migration we'll have in the database two accounts for the same username, one from internal and other for the AD accounts.
When the AD accounts are expired or we have to remove the user access from Jira, the Jira Access group is removed from his account.

*Expected*: Jira turn the user inactive in the database but keep his records.
*What happens*: Jira deletes the LDAP row from the cwd_user table

This causes any user that is expired or removed from the group, when restoring his access to Jira, Jira creates a new accounts instead of just reactivating the previous one, losing all it's group memberships and other information.


h3. Workaround
Only workaround we can apply is to manually remove the unused internal users from the cwd_user table.
The below query should do the trick, but review it to match your case and IDs may vary:

{code}delete from cwd_user 
where directory_id = 1 
and active = 0 
and user_name in (select user_name 
                              from cwd_user 
                              where directory_id = 10000 
                              and active = 1);{code}
fields.summary: Jira deletes AD user record from the cwd_user table when user is removed from Jira Access group if there is an internal account with the same username in the database

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Presently no IP information for nodes are stored in the *clusternode* table.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a new column to the table to store each node's IP address.

h3. Why this is important
In environments (such as AWS) where nodes may be added/removed with a degree of regularity, it would be very helpful to store IP address information for nodes. This can helpful to query for scripts that are targeted for specific nodes.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I'd like to see the IP addresses for my nodes stored in the clusternode table

fields.description:
*Summary*
 When deleting something in a workflow scheme on Jira Data Center, the entry in the 'clusterlockstatus' table remains left behind. The 'locked_by_node' for that row will be empty, but they pile up in large numbers.

*Environment*
 Jira Data Center 7.6.1/7.8.4 with two nodes
 Postgres 9.3 
h2. *Steps to Reproduce*

+*Scenario A, delete a workflow scheme*+
 1. Delete a workflow scheme.
 2. Once deleted, the 'clusterlockstatus' table will have a new entry like the example below (trailing number is corresponding to 'id' in 'workflowscheme' table.)
{noformat}
  id   |                                              lock_name                                               | locked_by_node |  update_time  
-------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------+---------------
 10505 | com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager$WorkflowAction.DELETE_SCHEME_10102          |                | 1542810654292
{noformat}
3. Repeat step 1 and another entry will be there (and so on).
{noformat}
  id   |                                              lock_name                                               | locked_by_node |  update_time  
-------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------+---------------
 10505 | com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager$WorkflowAction.DELETE_SCHEME_10102          |                | 1542810654292
 10506 | com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager$WorkflowAction.DELETE_SCHEME_10101          |                | 1542810700419
{noformat}
+*Scenario B, changing the associated issue types*+
 Edit a workflow scheme and add or remove an issue type.

Adding issue type to workflow scheme, 2 new rows added.
{noformat}
 10517 | com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager$WorkflowAction.DELETE_ENTITY_10108                |                | 1542812132748
 10518 | com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager$WorkflowAction.DELETE_ENTITY_10109                |                | 1542812132763
(67 rows)
{noformat}
Removing issue type from workflow scheme, 3 new rows added.
{noformat}
 10519 | com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager$WorkflowAction.DELETE_ENTITY_10110                |                | 1542812218880
 10520 | com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager$WorkflowAction.DELETE_ENTITY_10111                |                | 1542812218891
 10521 | com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager$WorkflowAction.DELETE_ENTITY_10112                |                | 1542812218904
(70 rows)
{noformat}
(trailing number corresponding to 'id' in 'workflowschemeentity')

 

*Expected Results*
 Once the operation is done, the entry in the 'clusterlockstatus' should be removed. 

*Actual Results*
 'lock_name' entries like "com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager$WorkflowAction.DELETE_ENTITY_10105" pile up in the 'clusterlockstatus' table. 
 One customer had over 8000 of them.

*Note*
Caused by JRASERVER-69114

*Workaround*
  If necessary, delete the unnecessary 'lock_name' entries manually.
fields.summary: Workflow scheme actions leave left-over rows in 'clusterlockstatus' table.

h3.Summary
Users on Data Center trying to open the CustomFieldOptimizer after the first scan will get a blank page and will not be able to make use of this feature.

h3. Symptoms

The 'Custom Field Optimizer' is running into the following NullPointerException:
{code}
2018-11-21 16:55:22,673 http-nio-7123-exec-18 ERROR admin 1015x455x2 14fjner 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/optimizer/1/recommendations/info [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.optimizer.ao.RecommendationsDao.parceProjectIdString(RecommendationsDao.java:74)
	at com.atlassian.jira.optimizer.beans.RecommendationBean.<init>(RecommendationBean.java:66)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
	at java.util.Spliterators$ArraySpliterator.forEachRemaining(Spliterators.java:948)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499)
	at com.atlassian.jira.optimizer.impl.RecommendationsManager.getRecommendations(RecommendationsManager.java:183)
	at com.atlassian.jira.optimizer.impl.DefaultOptimizerService.getRecommendationsInfo(DefaultOptimizerService.java:109)
	at com.atlassian.jira.optimizer.rest.OptimizerResource.getRecommendationsInfo(OptimizerResource.java:103)
	... 3 filtered
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	... 19 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter$JerseyOsgiServletContainer.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:154)
	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.RestDelegatingServletFilter.doFilter(RestDelegatingServletFilter.java:68)
	... 32 filtered
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.web.ExternalCustomerLockoutFilter.doFilter(ExternalCustomerLockoutFilter.java:56)
	... 13 filtered
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingFilter.doFilter(RedirectInterceptingFilter.java:21)
	... 53 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.lambda$doFilter$0(JiraSecurityFilter.java:66)
	... 1 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.JiraSecurityFilter.doFilter(JiraSecurityFilter.java:64)
	... 16 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.servlet.RestSeraphFilter.doFilter(RestSeraphFilter.java:37)
	... 19 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.CorrelationIdPopulatorFilter.doFilter(CorrelationIdPopulatorFilter.java:30)
	... 5 filtered
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.web.CustomerContextSettingFilter.lambda$invokeFilterChain$0(CustomerContextSettingFilter.java:181)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.api.util.context.ReentrantThreadLocalBasedCodeContext.rteInvoke(ReentrantThreadLocalBasedCodeContext.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.api.util.context.ReentrantThreadLocalBasedCodeContext.runOutOfContext(ReentrantThreadLocalBasedCodeContext.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.utils.context.CustomerContextServiceImpl.runOutOfCustomerContext(CustomerContextServiceImpl.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.web.CustomerContextSettingFilter.outOfCustomerContext(CustomerContextSettingFilter.java:174)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.web.CustomerContextSettingFilter.doFilterImpl(CustomerContextSettingFilter.java:130)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.web.CustomerContextSettingFilter.doFilter(CustomerContextSettingFilter.java:121)
	... 4 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jwt.internal.servlet.JwtAuthFilter.doFilter(JwtAuthFilter.java:32)
	... 8 filtered
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingFilter.doFilter(RedirectInterceptingFilter.java:21)
	... 4 filtered
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.LocationCleanerFilter.doFilter(LocationCleanerFilter.java:36)
	... 26 filtered
	at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.MetricsCollectorFilter.doFilter(MetricsCollectorFilter.java:25)
	... 24 filtered
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}

This is affecting JIRA application running with Oracle database.

h3. Cause:
When we run the optimizer scan, "AO_0AC321_RECOMMENDATION_AO" database table is populated. If the PROJECT_IDS is empty, NULL is inserted instead of en empty string -- for Oracle database.

package com.atlassian.jira.optimizer.ao  where class resides -
{code:title=RecommendationsDao.class}
public static List<Long> parceProjectIdString(String projectIdString) {
        return "".equals(projectIdString) ? Collections.emptyList() : (List)Stream.of(projectIdString.split(",")).map(Long::parseLong).collect(Collectors.toList());
    }
{code}

h3. Reproduce
# Create Oracle database for Jira
# Connect Jira DC to database
# Create Project (empty or sample)
# Create custom field with global context
# Navigate to *Jira administration* -> *System* -> *Custom Field Optimizer*
# Do initial scan
# Come back to 'Custom Field Optimizer' page

h3. Expected Results
User should see recommendations

h3. Actual Results
Blank screen for this feature

h3. Workaround 
No workaround for Oracle database users, as "AO_0AC321_RECOMMENDATION_AO" is always re-populated on scan, so removing the NULL records won't work.
fields.summary: Custom Field Optimizer shows blank screen (Jira Data Center) with Oracle database

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Quickstart AWS template for Jira does not set up SSL properly if an SSL certificate is specified during setup.

h3. Environment
* AWS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy a Jira AWS Quickstart template specifying an SSL certificate

h3. Expected Results
* The load balancer includes an SSL listener.
* {{JIRA_INSTALL/conf/server.xml}} includes the appropriate settings in the connector, like in the example below:
{code:xml|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
<Connector port="8080" relaxedPathChars="[]|" relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" connectionTimeout="20000" enableLookups="false" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" protocol="HTTP/1.1" useBodyEncodingForURI="true" redirectPort="8443" acceptCount="100" disableUploadTimeout="true" bindOnInit="false" secure="false" scheme="https" proxyName="<DOMAINNAME>" proxyPort="443"/>
{code}
* Base URL is correctly set to https://<DOMAINNAME>.

h3. Actual Results
* Load balancer does not include an SSL listener.
* The connector in {{JIRA_INSTALL/conf/server.xml}} has incorrect parameters such as {{scheme}} and {{proxyPort}}:
{code:xml|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
<Connector port="8080" relaxedPathChars="[]|" relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" connectionTimeout="20000" enableLookups="false" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" protocol="HTTP/1.1" useBodyEncodingForURI="true" redirectPort="8443" acceptCount="100" disableUploadTimeout="true" bindOnInit="false" secure="false" scheme="http" proxyName="<DOMAINNAME>" proxyPort="80"/>
{code}
* Base URL is set to http://<DOMAINNAME>.

h3.Workaround
* Manually add an SSL listener to the load balancer.
* Change the connector settings in {{JIRA_INSTALL/server.xml}} in all nodes to correctly set the {{proxyPort}}.
fields.summary: Quickstart AWS template for Jira does not set up SSL properly if an SSL certificate is specified during setup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Cannot create issue after populating assignable user field and modifying the assignee field on create issue screen 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field as Group Picker type (Single type/Multi group) 
 !CustomField.png|thumbnail! 
# Associate the custom field with the issue screen 
# Choose the newly created custom field as the value for Granted to for Assignable User for Issue permission for a project 
 !IssuePermission.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue and populate the Custom field and modify the Assignee field from Automatic to the desirable user (In this example , My group picker is the custom field whose value has been populated as jira-software-users and Assignee has been modified to local admin
# Issue does not get created and error pops up "User 'localadmin' cannot be assigned issues."
 !CreateIssue screen.png|thumbnail! 
# Once the Assignee field has been set back to Automatic/Unassigned the issue gets created.
# Post issue creation, the Assignee field can be modified to desired user

h3. Expected Results
Assignee field should get populated with desired user on create issue screen and issue should be allowed to get created 

h3. Actual Results
Issue does not get created and error is being thrown ""assignee: User 'XXXX' cannot be assigned issues."

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cannot create issues with "Assignable User" restricted by custom group field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Before Jira 7.6, it *was possible* to mark a priority as Default so that when users create new issues, Jira will pick that Default priority.
After 7.6 and the introduction of Priority Schemes, it is not possible to mark a priority as 'default' under Default Priority Scheme.

Next to that, when upgrading from pre 7.6 release to post 7.6 release, if there was a default priority set, then it is lost now.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a Jira instance on 7.5
# Set a particular priority as default
# Upgrade to Jira 7.7
# Notice that the default priority is now lost. So when users create an issue, Jira might start picking up a different default priority and there is no way to change this. 

h3. Expected Results
Jira should continue to use the old default priority and even provide means to change it.

h3. Actual Results
The default priority may have changed and there is no way to change it.
fields.summary: Unable to mark a priority as 'default' under Default Priority Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira, users have the option to configure which custom fields they'd like to show on screen while creating an issue via a Quick Create (clicking the *Create* button while viewing an existing issue, for example).

However, it appears that options will completely fail to show or render when there are too many custom fields configured; the actual threshold is still uncertain at this time.

h3. Environment
Jira 7.6.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a large number of custom fields in the instance (for this test, 30 custom fields were sufficient to reproduce the issue)
# Configure a screen to show these custom fields. Consider separating them between different tabs to exaggerate the issue.
# Set this screen as the *Create Issue* screen for a project and issue type
# Attempt to create an issue

h3. Expected Results

When attempting to select custom fields using the *Configure Fields* drop down list, all custom fields and tabs will show.

h3. Actual Results

Some tabs and fields will be missing completely. Some tabs and fields will be present, but there is no visible scroll bar to scroll down, and so a trackpad/mousewheel must be used.

Screen Configuration showing 5 different tabs:
 !Screen Configuration.png|thumbnail! 

*Tab4* and it's fields are completely missing:
 !Configure Fields.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Attempting to resize the zoom on the browser may allow some fields to come in and out of visibility, but this does not seem to affect the fields and tabs which were outright not rendered.
fields.summary: When creating an issue, Configure Fields list will have missing fields when there are too many custom fields

fields.summary: JIRA Server Custom Field Select List Popup Screen

fields.description:
In description field special characters can be created esily and effectively by combination of ASCII characters.

A very useful special character ("emoticon") is the yellow warning triangle, which can be created, inserting parenthesis+!+paranthesis, like (!)

This sign could be effectively used to mark tasks within a "Task Board" as "critical" or "escalated" if it could also be created within the subject line of a ticket.

Unfortunately this shortcut only creates a (!) if used within the "Description" field (see number 1 in added screenshots), but does not create a warning tiangle if used within the "Summary" field (see number 2 in added screenshots).

Consequently you cannot tag that way a task within a card (e.g. on a Jira task board), as it only would show up like number 3 in added screenshots.

We believe that Atlassian could increase the value of Jira very effectively and yet with low effort if creation of a yeellow warning triangle would also be enebled within Subject line !

+Suggested Change Request+:
 * *Enable creation of yellow warning triangle also within Subject line of Jira ticket !*

 

Remark:
JOPSCLOUD-128 seems to request a similar (the same ?) change, which would add significant benefit to Jira while only requiring almost negligable effort by Atlassian.
fields.summary: Please allow special character creation (e.g. ⚠️) also in summary line / cards

It would be useful to have some specific developer documentation in regards to what fields map to which events as this can be helpful from an event creation perspective.

fields.description:
Currently, in the Bulk Operation feature, there is already an option for moving the issues over to an existing or new project.  However, it would be very convenient and time saver to also have a bulk copy option. 

+*Use case*+
For our software, we have a large collection of dev and user requirements that always gets used each time we start a project, in addition to having to create new ones for the same project.  These requirements are detailed and have screenshots.  As a result, we created a "template" as a master project that houses all the re-usable requirements.  Since we can only bulk move the issues, we have to clone each issue individually from the master project template and then move them over to the new project. You can imagine how much time is wasted by having to do this each time we start a new project.  Having the option to bulk copy and then move at the same time so that we can keep the master project "template" in tact would be awesome!

Thank you!

Ruddiah Cinéus
Project Coordinator
Infoware
50 Richmond Street East
Toronto ON 

!image-2018-11-19-09-57-59-137.png!
fields.summary: Add a Bulk Copy option

fields.description:
Currently, Jira prepends global prefix to all outgoing mail notifications.

It would be useful if we would be able to modify the prefix to be marked as per project basis, so each project's notifications would contain prefix used with that specific project.

For example:
* Project ABC would prepend prefix [Project ABC]
* Project DEF would prepend prefix [Project DEF] etc.
fields.summary: Add prefix to outgoing notification as per project basis

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition.
From the link below, we could see that Postgres 9.3 is stated with the icon (!) that means "Deprecated - support for this platform will end in an upcoming release."
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html
(i) The documentation content might change following JIRA Releases as the link is for the latest available JIRA Server.

Where if we would like to get more information by going through the available [link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/end-of-support-announcements-938846831.html], it will mention that:
bq. Jira 7.12 will be the version of Jira to officially deprecate PostgreSQL 9.3.
In which, it seems that JIRA 7.12 is the last to support PostgreSQL 9.3 while JIRA 8 is the start where it is no longer supported.

h3. Suggested Solution.
Change the wording here as it could confuse the reader whether is it still supported on the version or not. For example:
- In the supported platform page "Deprecated - it is still supported on this version but will end in an upcoming release."
- Jira 7.12 will be the version of Jira to officially deprecate PostgreSQL 9.3 in which the last JIRA Release to support it.

Or any wording that clearly stated whether it is supported or no on the version.
fields.summary: PostgreSQL 9.3 Deprecation in the Supported Platform page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Duplicate users returned if a user exists in more than 1 directory.

+How to replicate+
 # Create a new User Directory in Jira
 # Populate the directory with the same username from the default Jira Internal Directory.
 # Reporter, and Request Participants fields now show duplicate users.

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.X, 8.X
h3. Expected Results

Crowd should be amalgamating these directories so that the identity is represented as only one person.

There are several use cases where one might have mixed directories. For example, one AD directory for internal groups, and one Jira directory for mixing AD users with Jira groups.
h3. Actual Results

Users with identical username who exist in different directories will be duplicated in user picker fields.
h3. Workaround

Jira >= 8.19.1:  Avoid using duplicate username or manually deactivate the user in the database (set active=0) (DB: cwd_user.active)

Jira < 8.19.1: Restart JIRA to clear the user cache (before 8.19.1)
fields.summary: Duplicate users returned if a user exists in more than 1 directory.

Vendor raised an issue they encountered when switching between project schemes, they implemented a solution as such:

fields.description:
Say there is a jql in advanced search as follows
{code:java}
project = SCRUM and resolution = Unresolved ORDER BY assignee ASC,affectedVersion ASC
{code}
Adding a clause like 'issuetype not in' before ORBER BY, removes all the text that appears after ORDER BY.

To replicate the problem.
 # Move the cursor before ORDER BY clause.
 # Start typing issuetype and select issuetype.
 # Start typing not in and select not in.
 # The entire text after ORDER BY including ORDER BY disappears
fields.summary: Part of advanced search JQL disappears when "not in" clause is selected inbetween

fields.summary: ability to change error messages to end users

fields.description:
{panel}
When viewing a Jira issue, the History tab records changes in assignee/reporter using *app_user.user_key*. This is the only place in the UI where this identifier, normally used only internally in Jira, is used. This should be *app_user.lower_user_name* to maintain consistency with other UI elements. Raising as a bug as this has GDPR implications; even after anonymizing usernames personal information could be leaked to the UI as *user_key* is an immutable value.
h4. Steps to Replicate
 # Create a user (e.g. {{jsmith}}).
 # Change its username (e.g. to {{john.smith}})
 # Go to any issue and select {{john.smith}} as either the assignee or the reporter.
 # Click on the History tab.
 # The change will display the username {{jsmith}} instead of {{john.smith}}:
 !userkey.png!

*Expected Result*
 Since the user key is only used internally by the application, we should not expose this information to end-users. The current username should be displayed instead ({{john.smith}}).

Additional information about the user rename feature:
 [https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Renamable+Users+in+JIRA+6.0]
fields.summary: Issue history displays user key instead of username for reporter or assignee changes

fields.description:
*Problem Experienced*

When a link is added _from_ the issue (e.g. by selecting More->Link on the issue view), both the database and Lucene index are updated.

When a link is added _to_ the issue (e.g. by mentioning it on a Confluence page or creating a reciprocal link from another issue), the database entry gets updated, but the Lucene index does not.

*Expected Behavior*

The Lucene index should get updated in both scenarios.

*Notes*

As far as I can tell, this is not a problem from the end-user perspective (they are still able to see proper content in the "Issue Links" panel, and there is a proper entry in the "History" tab).

The issue, however, makes index consistency analyzer tools unreliable, because they contain many entries with different "lastUpdated" times in the index and in the database, making them hard to use due to a lot of noise.
fields.summary: Jira does not reindex issues after a link is added to them

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Lucene uses {{org.apache.lucene.search.FieldCache}} to improve sort for text fields.  
Lucene loads corresponding structures from disk into memory and stores in {{FieldCache}}.

That means the bigger the Lucene Fields (including Jira CustomFields) size the more memory will be required for them in JVM heap

* For large Jira instances (4+ mln issues) {{FieldCache}} might use up to 9GB+, which adds extra pressure for the JVM

h3. Suggested Solution
Optimize memory usage of the {{FieldCache}}.
According to Lucene docs, those structures are gone in latest versions, so upgrade of Lucene 7+ should fix the problem. 
bq. Jira 8.0 no longer uses field caches to store lucene index parts in Java heap. They migrated this functionality to sth called Doc Values which does exactly the same but does not consume JVM heap space - it's all stored on disk and mmaped into process virtual memory.

h3. Note
Related bog 
https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/where-is-fieldcache-in-jira-8-0/28042 

h3. Workaround 
Since memory usage  is proportional to the size of the Lucene Fields, there are a couple of workarounds here, in the order of preference:
# *Disable Lucene search index for unused CustomFields*
** You can use the queries provided in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/managing-custom-fields-in-jira-effectively-945523781.html] to identify the unused custom fields. 
** In order to disable the Lucene search index for these fields, you can 'Edit' the custom filed and change the 'Search Template' to 'None', the Lucene search index for this custom field will be disabled.
# *Reduce scope for CustomFields (limit for specific projects)*
** You can find the custom fields with global contexts and then change them to specific projects by following the steps mentioned in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0713/custom-fields-with-global-contexts-964983618.html]. Try applying the changes in batches and during off-peak hours, since when one of your users opens an issue that uses a certain custom field, the cache will need to be recreated.
fields.summary: Improve FieldCache memory utilization for Jira instances with large Lucene
